title: Find where a tangent line has a particular slope

content.question: The function f is defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4197@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What points <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D6E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> on the graph of f have the property that the line tangent to f at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D6E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> has slope <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
